name: UILocalNotification
desc: Important:UILocalNotification is deprecated in iOS 10. Use UNNotificationRequest instead. A UILocalNotification object specifies a notification that an app can schedule for presentation at a specific date and time.

items.name: var fireDate: Date?
items.desc: The date and time when the system should deliver the notification.

items.name: var timeZone: TimeZone?
items.desc: The time zone of the notification’s fire date.

items.name: var repeatInterval: NSCalendar.Unit
items.desc: The calendar interval at which to reschedule the notification.

items.name: var repeatCalendar: Calendar?
items.desc: The calendar the system should refer to when it reschedules a repeating notification.

items.name: var region: CLRegion?
items.desc: The geographic region that triggers the notification.

items.name: var regionTriggersOnce: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether crossing a geographic region boundary delivers only one notification.

items.name: var alertBody: String?
items.desc: The message displayed in the notification alert.

items.name: var alertAction: String?
items.desc: The title of the action button or slider.

items.name: var alertTitle: String?
items.desc: A short description of the reason for the alert.

items.name: var hasAction: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that controls whether the notification shows or hides the alert action.

items.name: var alertLaunchImage: String?
items.desc: Identifies the image used as the launch image when the user taps (or slides) the action button (or slider).

items.name: var category: String?
items.desc: The name of a group of actions to display in the alert.

items.name: var applicationIconBadgeNumber: Int
items.desc: The number to display as the app’s icon badge.

items.name: var soundName: String?
items.desc: The name of the file containing the sound to play when an alert is displayed.

items.name: var userInfo: [AnyHashable : Any]?
items.desc: A dictionary for passing custom information to the notified app.
